data.message: Hi, I reported a post from Skagit County Sheriff's Department 7/15 and was sent the blanket response that it didn't violate FBs standards. The post in question has possibly destroyed a man and his small business. It was completely childish and unprofessional nothing of what you would expect of a Sheriff. On top of that, there was a photo of the small business with the business phone number on a sign. Since then this man and his family have received death threats. The sheriff of Skagit County used Facebook as a tool to destroy this man and his business. This was bullying and incites violence. Since there are not many options I'm using the FB page. Please look this up on their page and please look up the many news articles available about this situation.

replies.message: Thanks for reaching out to us, Hilary. Because of the diversity of our community, it's possible that something could be disagreeable to you without violating our Terms. For this reason, we offer personal controls over what you see in News Feed. You are free to hide or quietly unfriend or unfollow those people, Pages or apps that upset you. Facebook also offers tools to help you deal with bullying and harassment. Learn more about these controls and our community standards here: http://bit.ly/29DZxgS. -Ali
Yeah, I already know those things. It's not disagreeable, it's a crime.
Why do you have a large amount of information on bullying and harassment if you don't want to do anything about it?
Carmen Luz Panzardi they are the police
Doug Pettit Classy and grown up. Don't have any friends on FB to troll?
